CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in CH 3 CN using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate |
| CH3CN |
| glassy-carbon |
| polymer films |
| platinum-wire |
| Ag wire |
| AgCl |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate |
| polymer films |
| platinum-wire |
| Ag wire |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "CH3CN" - This is a chemical formula, not a material name.
* "glassy-carbon" - This is a material, but it is not specified as a "Material Name" in the paragraph.
* "AgCl" - This is a chemical formula, not a material name.
